private_information: I am visiting San Francisco for one day.
I arrive at Alamo Square at 09:00.
I want to meet as many friends as possible today.
I must meet Matthew for at least 15 minutes.
traveler.goal: Find a feasible day plan that maximizes the number of friends met and satisfies all hard constraints; at minimum, schedule a meeting with Matthew for at least 15 minutes within his availability window.

private_information: I can evaluate travel times and compute feasible arrival times based on provided distances.
map_reader.goal: Provide candidate departure and arrival options between locations that respect time windows and travel durations.

private_information: I coordinate the other agents and compile the final plan and artifacts.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' analyses, select the best schedule satisfying all constraints, and emit the final PDDL domain and problem compatible with the FastDownwards planner.

public_information: You arrive at Alamo Square at 9:00AM.
Matthew will be at Sunset District from 1:30PM (810) to 2:30PM (870).
You want to meet Matthew for at least 15 minutes.
Travel time from Alamo Square to Sunset District is 16 minutes; from Sunset District to Alamo Square is 17 minutes.
Objective: meet as many friends as possible today; the only scheduled friend in this data is Matthew.

analyze_constraints.system_prompt: You are a personal itinerary planner for a one-day visit. Your job is to restate hard constraints, soft preferences, and propose a few feasible schedule options without producing PDDL.
analyze_constraints.prompt: Your name is traveler. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->traveler->goal}. Produce a concise list of constraints and 2-4 candidate schedules that respect the time windows and travel durations; clearly note earliest and latest feasible departure times from Alamo Square to meet Matthew for at least 15 minutes.

travel_options.system_prompt: You analyze urban travel durations to derive feasible departure and arrival windows. Do not output PDDL.
travel_options.prompt: Your name is map_reader. Public information: {environment->public_information}. Your knowledge: {agents->map_reader->private_information}. Compute earliest arrival at Sunset District given departure at or after 09:00 from Alamo Square, and enumerate feasible meeting start times that allow at least 15 minutes with Matthew within his 13:30-14:30 window. Summarize options with travel directions and times.

compile_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling who must integrate analyses and produce a final classical PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
compile_pddl.prompt: Integrate: {traveler_summary} and {routes_analysis}. Choose the best schedule that satisfies all constraints and meets Matthew for at least 15 minutes. Then produce a PDDL domain and problem for a single agent representing the traveler, suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Model locations alamo_square and sunset_district, a predicate for being at a location, and a numeric fluent t representing minutes since 00:00. Initialize t to 540 (09:00) and the agent at alamo_square. Provide actions: move_as_to_sd increasing t by 16 and moving from alamo_square to sunset_district, move_sd_to_as increasing t by 17 and moving back, an optional wait action that increases t by a fixed positive integer constant, and meet_matthew that requires being at sunset_district with preconditions 810 <= t <= 855 and increases t by 15 while setting a predicate met_matthew true. Assign action costs equal to the time increase and include a metric to minimize total-cost. Set the goal to met_matthew.
